content: Hello everyone. I hope that I have opened the subject in the right place. Friends, the biggest earthquake in history happened in Turkey which is the country I live in. And unfortunately we have got the information that thousands of people have died. As the time goes on we see the affect of the natural disaster more. We see cities literally falling to pieces completely. We still can't reach our acquaintances living in the area although there have been many hours passed.Besides people in the area have to deal with the freezing cold now. Therefore I think we can start an aid campaign on the forum to help the people in the area to get blankets, food and tents at least.Some shots from the earthquake area...https://www.hizliresim.com/qf9aol4https://www.hizliresim.com/hlj82fnhttps://www.hizliresim.com/7iq9hkmThe moment of a building falling down A mother whose children are trapped in the wreckage is calling for help The final situation of the citizens who have got out of a dispensary

comments.author: RaltcoinsB
comments.body: I am one of those who live very violently.¬† The earthquake woke us up at night in our sleep.¬† We tried to ensure the safety of my daughter, who is close to 2 years old, and moved to safe areas.¬† Since I was going to work 1 hour later, we felt the need to go back to the building and collect our belongings.¬† I can say that I have close friends participating in the search efforts since yesterday and the situation is worse than it seems.¬† Especially since 2 large state hospitals were destroyed in the city of Hatay, those who were injured and died in the earthquake are transferred from the port to the city of Mersin by ships.¬† A relative of my wife works in Kahramanmara≈ü and our minds are there.¬† Adverse weather conditions greatly affect the work.¬† In Kahramanmara≈ü, there is an air temperature that goes down to minus 10 degrees at night.¬† This is the most unfavorable situation that also affects the volunteer helpers.¬† Searches are generally tried to be made by human power.¬† Many of my colleagues in Turkey Police officers were sent to the region as reinforcements.¬† There are problems such as electricity, natural gas, drinking water.¬† That's why this issue is so important.¬† There was a flood disaster in Pakistan, which I remember recently.¬† Apart from that, it was one of the most effective disasters.¬† Two of the biggest earthquakes in Turkey's history occurred within 9 hours of each other.¬† I hope it doesn't happen again.¬† If there are new developments, I will try to write, but right now people are completely focused on the region.
